member.name: T:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.SwimlaneViewModel
member.summary: Represents a cluster multiple nodes and connectors into a single element. It acts like a container for its children (nodes, groups, and connectors).
member.example:
Below example explains how to add swimlane into diagram control.
<!-- Initialize the Sfdiagram --> <Syncfusion:SfDiagram x:Name="diagram"> <Syncfusion:SfDiagram.Swimlanes> <!-- Initialize the SwimlaneCollection --> <Syncfusion:SwimlaneCollection> <!--Initialize the Swimlane--> <Syncfusion:SwimlaneViewModel OffsetX = "300" OffsetY="150" UnitHeight="120" UnitWidth="450"/> </Syncfusion:SwimlaneCollection> </Syncfusion:SfDiagram.Swimlanes> </Syncfusion:SfDiagram>
member.summary: Represents a cluster multiple nodes, connectors and group into a single element. It acts like a container for its children (nodes, groups, and connectors).

member.name: T:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.LaneViewModel
member.summary: Represents a lane is a functional unit or a responsible department of a business process that helps to map a process within the functional unit or in between other functional units.

example.code: <syncfusion:SfDiagram x:Name="diagram" > <syncfusion:SfDiagram.Swimlanes> <!--Initialize the SwimlaneCollection--> <syncfusion:SwimlaneCollection> <!--Initialize the Swimlane--> <syncfusion:SwimlaneViewModel OffsetX = "300" OffsetY="150" UnitHeight="120" UnitWidth="450"> <!--Create a header for Swimlane--> <syncfusion:SwimlaneViewModel.Header> <syncfusion:SwimlaneHeader UnitHeight = "32" > <syncfusion:SwimlaneHeader.Annotation> <syncfusion:AnnotationEditorViewModel Content="SALES PROCESS FLOW CHART"> </syncfusion:AnnotationEditorViewModel> </syncfusion:SwimlaneHeader.Annotation> </syncfusion:SwimlaneHeader> </syncfusion:SwimlaneViewModel.Header> <syncfusion:SwimlaneViewModel.Lanes> <syncfusion:LaneCollection> <!--Initialize the Lane--> <syncfusion:LaneViewModel UnitHeight = "100"> </syncfusion:LaneViewModel> </syncfusion:LaneCollection> </syncfusion:SwimlaneViewModel.Lanes> </syncfusion:SwimlaneViewModel> </syncfusion:SwimlaneCollection> </syncfusion:SfDiagram.Swimlanes> </syncfusion:SfDiagram>

member.name: T:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.PhaseViewModel
member.summary: Represents a phase is the subprocess which will split each lanes as horizontally or vertically based on the Swimlane orientation.

example.code: <syncfusion:SfDiagram x:Name="diagram" > <syncfusion:SfDiagram.Swimlanes> <!--Initialize the SwimlaneCollection--> <syncfusion:SwimlaneCollection> <!--Initialize the Swimlane--> <syncfusion:SwimlaneViewModel OffsetX = "300" OffsetY="150" UnitHeight="120" UnitWidth="450"> <!--Create a header for Swimlane--> <syncfusion:SwimlaneViewModel.Header> <syncfusion:SwimlaneHeader UnitHeight = "32" > <syncfusion:SwimlaneHeader.Annotation> <syncfusion:AnnotationEditorViewModel Content = "SALES PROCESS FLOW CHART" > </syncfusion:AnnotationEditorViewModel> </syncfusion:SwimlaneHeader.Annotation> </syncfusion:SwimlaneHeader> </syncfusion:SwimlaneViewModel.Header> <syncfusion:SwimlaneViewModel.Phases> <syncfusion:PhaseCollection> <!--Initialize the Phase--> <syncfusion:PhaseViewModel UnitWidth = "450" > <syncfusion:PhaseViewModel.Header> <!--Create a header for Phase--> <syncfusion:SwimlaneHeader UnitHeight = "30" > <syncfusion:SwimlaneHeader.Annotation> <syncfusion:AnnotationEditorViewModel Content = "Phase1" ></syncfusion:AnnotationEditorViewModel> </syncfusion:SwimlaneHeader.Annotation> </syncfusion:SwimlaneHeader> </syncfusion:PhaseViewModel.Header> </syncfusion:PhaseViewModel> </syncfusion:PhaseCollection> </syncfusion:SwimlaneViewModel.Phases> </syncfusion:SwimlaneViewModel> </syncfusion:SwimlaneCollection> </syncfusion:SfDiagram.Swimlanes> </syncfusion:SfDiagram>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagramViewModel.HasChanges
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the diagram has any unsaved changes since the last save.
member.value: true, if the document has unsaved changes; otherwise, false.
member.Remarks: SfDiagram tracks all changes that are done on the diagram contents, either programmatically or by users. If there are changes that are still not saved, the property has value of true. The HasChanges flag is cleared automatically when a document is loaded from file or stream. Also, when a document is saved, the HasChanges flag will be cleared automatically.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.IDiagramCommands.EditAnnotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the command of the which will enble annotation editing mode of the first selected diagram element.
member.example:
Below example shows how to execute the command.
<Syncfusion:SfDiagram x:Name="Diagram" /> <!--Initialize the Button to Execute Edit command--> <Button x:Name="Edit" Content="EditAnnotation" Height="40" Width="130" HorizontalAlignment="Center" VerticalAlignment="Center" Command="{Binding ElementName=Diagram,Path=Info.Commands.EditAnnotation}"/>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.IDiagramCommands.Cancel
member.summary: Gets or sets the command of the which will cancel the currently performing action in diagram.

remarks.para: Currently this command will cancel the following actions
1. Stop the annotation editing and accept the curent value.
2. Reset the diagram tool to select tool
3. Clear the selection of diagram elements

member.example:
Below example shows how to execute the command
<Syncfusion:SfDiagram x:Name="Diagram" /> <!--Initialize the Button to Execute Cancel command--> <Button x:Name="Cancel" Content="Cancel" Height="40" Width="130" HorizontalAlignment="Center" VerticalAlignment="Center" Command="{Binding ElementName=Diagram,Path=Info.Commands.Cancel}"/>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.IDiagramCommands.SelectTool
member.summary: Gets or sets the command of the which will change the and properties to specified values.
member.remarks: This command will receive as command which contains the , and informations to enable drawing tool option in diagram.
member.example:
Below example shows how to execute the command and provide value for the command using click event.
<Syncfusion:SelectToolCommandParameter DrawingTool="Ellipse" Tool="ContinuesDraw" x:Key="SelectToolEllipseCommandParameter"/> <Syncfusion:SelectToolCommandParameter DrawingTool=" Connector" Tool="ContinuesDraw" ConnectorType =” Connector” x:Key="SelectToolConnectorCommandParameter"/> <Syncfusion:SfDiagram x:Name="Diagram" /> <!--Initialize the Button to Execute SelectTool command for enable EllipseTool --> <Button x:Name="EllipseTool" Content="Rotate ClockWise" Height="40" Width="130" HorizontalAlignment="Center" VerticalAlignment="Center" Command="{Binding ElementName=Diagram,Path=Info.Commands. SelectTool}" CommandParameter="{StaticResource SelectToolEllipseCommandParameter}"/> <!--Initialize the Button to Execute SelectTool command for enable Connector Tool--> <Button x:Name="ConnectorTool" Content="ConnectorTool" Height="40" Width="130" HorizontalAlignment="Center" VerticalAlignment="Center" Command="{Binding ElementName=Diagram,Path=Info.Commands. SelectTool}" CommandParameter="{StaticResource SelectToolConnectorCommandParameter }"/>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagrammingCommands.Undo
member.summary: The Undo command reverses the last editing action performed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagrammingCommands.Zoom
member.summary: Zoom commands are used to zoom-in and zoom-out the Diagram view.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagrammingCommands.Reset
member.summary: Reset commands are used to reset horizontal Offset, vertical Offset, and zoom level of the Diagram.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagrammingCommands.Redo
member.summary: The Redo command restores the last editing action if no other actions have occurred since the last undo.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagrammingCommands.Group
member.summary: Grouping commands are used to group/ungroup the selected elements on the diagram.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagrammingCommands.UnGroup
member.summary: Grouping commands are used to group/ungroup the selected elements on the diagram.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagrammingCommands.SameSize
member.summary: Object size commands enable selected Diagram objects on the page to be resized. The selected objects are resized in proportion to the first object in the selection list.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagrammingCommands.SameHeight
member.summary: Object size commands enable selected Diagram objects on the page to be resized. The selected objects are resized in proportion to the first object in the selection list.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagrammingCommands.SameWidth
member.summary: Object size commands enable selected Diagram objects on the page to be resized. The selected objects are resized in proportion to the first object in the selection list.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagrammingCommands.AlignBottom
member.summary: The AlignBottom command enables you to align all selected objects along the bottom surface of the reference object.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagrammingCommands.AlignTop
member.summary: The AlignTop command enables you to align all selected objects along the top surface of the reference object.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagrammingCommands.AlignLeft
member.summary: The AlignLeft command enables you to align all selected objects along the left corner of the reference object.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagrammingCommands.AlignCenter
member.summary: The AlignCenter command enables you to center all selected objects vertically. It aligns selected objects to the center with respect to the horizontal axis by changing the x-coordinate of the object.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagrammingCommands.AlignRight
member.summary: The AlignRight command enables you to align all selected objects along the right corner of the reference object.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagrammingCommands.AlignMiddle
member.summary: The AlignMiddle command enables you to center all selected objects horizontally. It aligns selected objects to the center with respect to the vertical axis by changing the y-coordinate of the object.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagrammingCommands.SpaceAcross
member.summary: The SpaceAcross equally spaces the selected nodes horizontally

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagrammingCommands.SpaceDown
member.summary: The SpaceDown equally spaces the selected nodes vertically

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagrammingCommands.SendToBack
member.summary: The SendToBack command visually moves the selected elements behind all the other overlapped elements.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagrammingCommands.SendBackward
member.summary: The SendBackward command visually moves the selected elements behind the underlying element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagrammingCommands.BringToFront
member.summary: The BringToFront command visually brings the selected element to the front over all other overlapped elements.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagrammingCommands.BringForward
member.summary: The BringForward command visually moves the selected element over the nearest overlapping element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagrammingCommands.MoveDown
member.summary: The MoveDown command moves the selected object towards the bottom by 1 pixel.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagrammingCommands.MoveUp
member.summary: The MoveUp command moves the selected object towards the top by 1 pixel.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagrammingCommands.MoveLeft
member.summary: The MoveLeft command moves the selected object towards the left by 1 pixel.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagrammingCommands.MoveRight
member.summary: The MoveRight command moves the selected object towards the right by 1 pixel.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagrammingCommands.Cut
member.summary: Cuts the selected elements from the Diagram to the Diagram’s clipboard

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagrammingCommands.Copy
member.summary: Copies the selected elements from the Diagram to the Diagram’s clipboard.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagrammingCommands.Paste
member.summary: Pastes the Diagram’s clipboard data (nodes/connectors) into the Diagram.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagrammingCommands.EditAnnotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the command of the which will enble annotation editing mode of the first selected diagram element.
member.example:
Below example shows how to execute the command.
<Syncfusion:SfDiagram x:Name="Diagram" /> <!--Initialize the Button to Execute Edit command--> <Button x:Name="Edit" Content="EditAnnotation" Height="40" Width="130" HorizontalAlignment="Center" VerticalAlignment="Center" Command="{Binding ElementName=Diagram,Path=Info.Commands.EditAnnotation}"/>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagrammingCommands.Cancel
member.summary: Gets or sets the command of the which will cancel the currently performing action in diagram.

remarks.para: Currently this command will cancel the following actions
1. Stop the annotation editing and accept the curent value.
2. Reset the diagram tool to select tool
3. Clear the selection of diagram elements

member.example:
Below example shows how to execute the command
<Syncfusion:SfDiagram x:Name="Diagram" /> <!--Initialize the Button to Execute Cancel command--> <Button x:Name="Cancel" Content="Cancel" Height="40" Width="130" HorizontalAlignment="Center" VerticalAlignment="Center" Command="{Binding ElementName=Diagram,Path=Info.Commands.Cancel}"/>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagrammingCommands.SelectTool
member.summary: Gets or sets the command of the which will change the and properties to specified values.
member.remarks: This command will receive as command which contains the , and informations to enable drawing tool option in diagram.
member.example:
Below example shows how to execute the command and provide value for the command using click event.
<Syncfusion:SelectToolCommandParameter DrawingTool="Ellipse" Tool="ContinuesDraw" x:Key="SelectToolEllipseCommandParameter"/> <Syncfusion:SelectToolCommandParameter DrawingTool=" Connector" Tool="ContinuesDraw" ConnectorType =” Connector” x:Key="SelectToolConnectorCommandParameter"/> <Syncfusion:SfDiagram x:Name="Diagram" /> <!--Initialize the Button to Execute SelectTool command for enable EllipseTool --> <Button x:Name="EllipseTool" Content="Rotate ClockWise" Height="40" Width="130" HorizontalAlignment="Center" VerticalAlignment="Center" Command="{Binding ElementName=Diagram,Path=Info.Commands. SelectTool}" CommandParameter="{StaticResource SelectToolEllipseCommandParameter}"/> <!--Initialize the Button to Execute SelectTool command for enable Connector Tool--> <Button x:Name="ConnectorTool" Content="ConnectorTool" Height="40" Width="130" HorizontalAlignment="Center" VerticalAlignment="Center" Command="{Binding ElementName=Diagram,Path=Info.Commands. SelectTool}" CommandParameter="{StaticResource SelectToolConnectorCommandParameter }"/>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagramCommands.AlignBottom
member.summary: Gets or sets the AlignBottom command to invoke when to align all selected objects along the bottom surface of the reference object.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagramCommands.AlignTop
member.summary: Gets or sets the AlignTop command to invoke when to align all selected objects along the top surface of the reference object.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagramCommands.AlignLeft
member.summary: Gets or sets the AlignLeft command to invoke when to align all selected objects along the left corner of the reference object.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagramCommands.AlignCenter
member.summary: Gets or sets the AlignCenter command to invoke when to align center all selected objects vertically. It aligns selected objects to the center with respect to the horizontal axis by changing the x-coordinate of the object.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagramCommands.AlignRight
member.summary: Gets or sets the AlignRight command to invoke when to align all selected objects along the right corner of the reference object.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagramCommands.AlignMiddle
member.summary: Gets or sets the AlignMiddle command to invoke when to align center all selected objects horizontally. It aligns selected objects to the center with respect to the vertical axis by changing the y-coordinate of the object.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagramCommands.SpaceAcross
member.summary: Gets or sets the SpaceAcross command, to equally spaces the selected nodes horizontally.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagramCommands.SpaceDown
member.summary: Gets or sets the SpaceDown command, to equally spaces the selected nodes vertically.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagramCommands.SendToBack
member.summary: Gets or sets the SendToBack command, to visually moves the selected elements behind all the other overlapped elements.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagramCommands.SendBackward
member.summary: Gets or sets the SendBackward command, to visually moves the selected elements behind the underlying element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagramCommands.BringToFront
member.summary: Gets or sets the BringToFront command, to visually brings the selected element to the front over all other overlapped elements.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagramCommands.BringForward
member.summary: Gets or sets the BringForward command, to moves the selected element over the nearest overlapping element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagramCommands.MoveDown

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagramCommands.MoveRight

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagramCommands.Cancel
member.summary: Gets or sets the command of the which will cancel the currently performing action in diagram.

remarks.para: Currently this command will cancel the following actions
1. Stop the annotation editing and accept the curent value.
2. Reset the diagram tool to select tool
3. Clear the selection of diagram elements

member.example:
Below example shows how to execute the command
<Syncfusion:SfDiagram x:Name="Diagram" /> <!--Initialize the Button to Execute Cancel command--> <Button x:Name="Cancel" Content="Cancel" Height="40" Width="130" HorizontalAlignment="Center" VerticalAlignment="Center" Command="{Binding ElementName=Diagram,Path=Info.Commands.Cancel}"/>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagramCommands.EditAnnotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the command of the which will enble annotation editing mode of the first selected diagram element.
member.example:
Below example shows how to execute the command.
<Syncfusion:SfDiagram x:Name="Diagram" /> <!--Initialize the Button to Execute Edit command--> <Button x:Name="Edit" Content="EditAnnotation" Height="40" Width="130" HorizontalAlignment="Center" VerticalAlignment="Center" Command="{Binding ElementName=Diagram,Path=Info.Commands.EditAnnotation}"/>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.DiagramCommands.SelectTool
member.summary: Gets or sets the command of the which will change the and properties to specified values.
member.remarks: This command will receive as command which contains the , and informations to enable drawing tool option in diagram.
member.example:
Below example shows how to execute the command and provide value for the command using click event.
<Syncfusion:SelectToolCommandParameter DrawingTool="Ellipse" Tool="ContinuesDraw" x:Key="SelectToolEllipseCommandParameter"/> <Syncfusion:SelectToolCommandParameter DrawingTool=" Connector" Tool="ContinuesDraw" ConnectorType =” Connector” x:Key="SelectToolConnectorCommandParameter"/> <Syncfusion:SfDiagram x:Name="Diagram" /> <!--Initialize the Button to Execute SelectTool command for enable EllipseTool --> <Button x:Name="EllipseTool" Content="Rotate ClockWise" Height="40" Width="130" HorizontalAlignment="Center" VerticalAlignment="Center" Command="{Binding ElementName=Diagram,Path=Info.Commands. SelectTool}" CommandParameter="{StaticResource SelectToolEllipseCommandParameter}"/> <!--Initialize the Button to Execute SelectTool command for enable Connector Tool--> <Button x:Name="ConnectorTool" Content="ConnectorTool" Height="40" Width="130" HorizontalAlignment="Center" VerticalAlignment="Center" Command="{Binding ElementName=Diagram,Path=Info.Commands. SelectTool}" CommandParameter="{StaticResource SelectToolConnectorCommandParameter }"/>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.SfDiagram.HasChanges
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the diagram has any unsaved changes since the last save.
member.value: true, if the document has unsaved changes; otherwise, false.
member.Remarks: SfDiagram tracks all changes that are done on the diagram contents, either programmatically or by users. If there are changes that are still not saved, the property has value of true. The HasChanges flag is cleared automatically when a document is loaded from file or stream. Also, when a document is saved, the HasChanges flag will be cleared automatically.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.Layout.BranchDirection.LeftInFlow

member.name: T:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.Layout.FlowchartOrientation
member.summary: Specifies the different types of Orientation in class.
member.example:
Below example shows how to create flowchart layout
<local:DataItems x:Key="Dataitems"> <local:ItemInfo Id = "1" NodeShape="{StaticResource Terminator}" Width="80" Height="35" Name="Start"/> <local:ItemInfo Id = "2" NodeShape="{StaticResource Data}" Width="90" Height="35" Name="Input"> <local:ItemInfo.ParentId> <local:LabelList> <sys:String>1</sys:String> </local:LabelList> </local:ItemInfo.ParentId> </local:ItemInfo> <local:ItemInfo Id = "3" NodeShape="{StaticResource Decision}" Width="80" Height="60" Name="Decision?"> <local:ItemInfo.ParentId> <local:LabelList> <sys:String>2</sys:String> </local:LabelList> </local:ItemInfo.ParentId> </local:ItemInfo> <local:ItemInfo Id = "4" NodeShape="{StaticResource Process}" Width="80" Height="40" Name="Process1"> <local:ItemInfo.ParentId> <local:LabelList> <sys:String>3</sys:String> </local:LabelList> </local:ItemInfo.ParentId> <local:ItemInfo.Label> <local:LabelList> <sys:String>Yes</sys:String> </local:LabelList> </local:ItemInfo.Label> </local:ItemInfo> <local:ItemInfo Id = "5" NodeShape="{StaticResource Process}" Width="80" Height="40" Name="Process2"> <local:ItemInfo.ParentId> <local:LabelList> <sys:String>3</sys:String> </local:LabelList> </local:ItemInfo.ParentId> <local:ItemInfo.Label> <local:LabelList> <sys:String>No</sys:String> </local:LabelList> </local:ItemInfo.Label> </local:ItemInfo> <local:ItemInfo Id = "6" NodeShape="{StaticResource Data}" Width="90" Height="35" Name="Output"> <local:ItemInfo.ParentId> <local:LabelList> <sys:String>5</sys:String> </local:LabelList> </local:ItemInfo.ParentId> </local:ItemInfo> <local:ItemInfo Id = "7" NodeShape="{StaticResource Data}" Width="90" Height="35" Name="Output"> <local:ItemInfo.ParentId> <local:LabelList> <sys:String>4</sys:String> </local:LabelList> </local:ItemInfo.ParentId> </local:ItemInfo> <local:ItemInfo Id = "8" NodeShape="{StaticResource Terminator}" Width="80" Height="35" Name="End"> <local:ItemInfo.ParentId> <local:LabelList> <sys:String>6</sys:String> <sys:String>7</sys:String> </local:LabelList> </local:ItemInfo.ParentId> </local:ItemInfo> </local:DataItems> <!--Initializes the Layout--> <Syncfusion:FlowchartLayout x:Key="Layout" Orientation="LeftToRight" HorizontalSpacing="50" VerticalSpacing="30" YesBranchDirection="LeftInFlow" NoBranchDirection="RightInFlow"> </Syncfusion:FlowchartLayout> <!--Initializes the LayoutManager--> <Syncfusion:LayoutManager x:Key="layoutmanager" Layout="{StaticResource Layout}"/> <!--Initializes the DataSourceSettings --> <Syncfusion:FlowchartDataSourceSettings x:Key="dataSourceSettings" DataSource="{StaticResource Dataitems}" ParentId="ParentId" Id="Id" ShapeMapping="NodeShape" WidthMapping="Width" HeightMapping="Height" ConnectorTextMapping="Label" ContentMapping="Name"/> <!--Initializes the SfDiagram --> <Syncfusion:SfDiagram x:Name="diagram" Grid.Column="0" LayoutManager="{StaticResource layoutmanager}" DataSourceSettings="{StaticResource dataSourceSettings}"> </Syncfusion:SfDiagram>

member.summary: Gets or sets the root node of the layout.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.Layout.FlowchartLayout.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the orientation of the layout.

example.code: <!--Initializes the Layout--> <syncfusion:FlowchartLayout x:Key="Layout" Orientation="LeftToRight" HorizontalSpacing="50" VerticalSpacing="30" YesBranchDirection="LeftInFlow" NoBranchDirection="RightInFlow"> </syncfusion:FlowchartLayout> <!--Initializes the LayoutManager--> <syncfusion:LayoutManager x:Key="layoutmanager" Layout="{StaticResource Layout}"/> <!--Initializes the DataSourceSettings --> <syncfusion:FlowchartDataSourceSettings x:Key="DataSourceSettings" DataSource="{StaticResource Dataitems}" ParentId="ParentId" Id="Id" ShapeMapping="NodeShape" WidthMapping="Width" HeightMapping="Height" ConnectorTextMapping="Label" ContentMapping="Name"/> <!--Initializes the SfDiagram --> <syncfusion:SfDiagram x:Name="diagram" Grid.Column="0" LayoutManager="{StaticResource layoutmanager}" DataSourceSettings="{StaticResource DataSourceSettings}"> </syncfusion:SfDiagram>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.Layout.FlowchartLayout.YesBranchDirection
member.summary: Gets or sets the direction of yes branches.

example.code:
<!--Initializes the Layout--> <syncfusion:FlowchartLayout x:Key="Layout" Orientation="LeftToRight" HorizontalSpacing="50" VerticalSpacing="30" YesBranchDirection="LeftInFlow" NoBranchDirection="RightInFlow"> </syncfusion:FlowchartLayout> <!--Initializes the LayoutManager--> <syncfusion:LayoutManager x:Key="layoutmanager" Layout="{StaticResource Layout}"/> <!--Initializes the DataSourceSettings --> <syncfusion:FlowchartDataSourceSettings x:Key="DataSourceSettings" DataSource="{StaticResource Dataitems}" ParentId="ParentId" Id="Id" ShapeMapping="NodeShape" WidthMapping="Width" HeightMapping="Height" ConnectorTextMapping="Label" ContentMapping="Name"/>
<!--Initializes the SfDiagram --> <syncfusion:SfDiagram x:Name="diagram" Grid.Column="0" LayoutManager="{StaticResource layoutmanager}" DataSourceSettings="{StaticResource DataSourceSettings}"> </syncfusion:SfDiagram>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.Layout.FlowchartLayout.NoBranchDirection
member.summary: Gets or sets the direction of no branches.

example.code: <!--Initializes the Layout--> <syncfusion:FlowchartLayout x:Key="Layout" Orientation="LeftToRight" HorizontalSpacing="50" VerticalSpacing="30" YesBranchDirection="LeftInFlow" NoBranchDirection="RightInFlow"> </syncfusion:FlowchartLayout> <!--Initializes the LayoutManager--> <syncfusion:LayoutManager x:Key="layoutmanager" Layout="{StaticResource Layout}"/> <!--Initializes the DataSourceSettings --> <syncfusion:FlowchartDataSourceSettings x:Key="DataSourceSettings" DataSource="{StaticResource Dataitems}" ParentId="ParentId" Id="Id" ShapeMapping="NodeShape" WidthMapping="Width" HeightMapping="Height" ConnectorTextMapping="Label" ContentMapping="Name"/> <!--Initializes the SfDiagram --> <syncfusion:SfDiagram x:Name="diagram" Grid.Column="0" LayoutManager="{StaticResource layoutmanager}" DataSourceSettings="{StaticResource DataSourceSettings}"> </syncfusion:SfDiagram>

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.Layout.RootChildDirection.Top

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.Layout.RootChildDirection.Right

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.Layout.RootChildDirection.Bottom
member.summary: Specifies the branch should be positioned in bottom direction.
member.remarks: Bootom direction is supported only for vertical orientation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.Layout.MindMapTreeLayout.LayoutRoot
member.summary: Gets or sets the root node of the layout.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.Layout.MindMapTreeLayout.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the dimension by which child elements are layouted in the mind-map tree.
member.example:
Below example shows how the mind-map tree orientation is assigned for MindMapTreeLayout # [ViewModel.cs](#tab/tabid-1)
diagram.LayoutManager = new LayoutManager() { Layout = new MindMapTreeLayout() { Orientation = Orientation.Horizontal, }, };
# [MainWindow.xaml](#tab/tabid-2) This example shows how the mind-map tree orientation is assigned for MindMapTreeLayout
<!--Initializes the DataSourceSettings --> <Syncfusion:DataSourceSettings x:Key="dataSourceSettings" Id="Label" ParentId="ParentId" DataSource="{StaticResource datasource}" /> <Syncfusion:MindMapTreeLayout x:Key="Mindmaplayout" HorizontalSpacing="50" VerticalSpacing="30" Orientation="Horizontal" SplitMode="Custom" /> <!--Initialize the Layout Manager--> <Syncfusion:LayoutManager x:Key="layoutManager" Layout="{StaticResource Mindmaplayout}"/> <!--Initializes the SfDiagram--> <Syncfusion:SfDiagram x:Name="Diagram" DataSourceSettings="{StaticResource dataSourceSettings}" LayoutManager="{Binding layoutManager}"/>
***

member.name: P:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.Layout.MindMapTreeLayout.SplitMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the criteria for arranging the mind map branches.
member.example:
Below example shows how to arrange the mind map branches for MindMapTreeLayout # [ViewModel.cs](#tab/tabid-1)
diagram.LayoutManager = new LayoutManager() { Layout = new MindMapTreeLayout() { SplitMode = MindMapTreeMode.Area, }, };
# [MainWindow.xaml](#tab/tabid-2) This example shows how to arrange the mind map branches for MindMapTreeLayout
<!--Initializes the DataSourceSettings --> <Syncfusion:DataSourceSettings x:Key="dataSourceSettings" Id="Label" ParentId="ParentId" DataSource="{StaticResource datasource}" /> <Syncfusion:MindMapTreeLayout x:Key="Mindmaplayout" HorizontalSpacing="50" VerticalSpacing="30" Orientation="Horizontal" SplitMode="Area" /> <!--Initialize the Layout Manager--> <Syncfusion:LayoutManager x:Key="layoutManager" Layout="{StaticResource Mindmaplayout}"/> <!--Initializes the SfDiagram--> <Syncfusion:SfDiagram x:Name="Diagram" DataSourceSettings="{StaticResource dataSourceSettings}" LayoutManager="{Binding layoutManager}"/>
***

members.member:
Gets or sets the title of the Stencil. The default title is null.
Below example shows how to update the title for stencil.
<syncfusion:Stencil x:Name="stencil" Width="250" ExpandMode="All" Title="Stencil Shapes"> <!--Initialize the SymbolSource--> <syncfusion:Stencil.SymbolSource> <!--Define the SymbolCollection--> <syncfusion:SymbolCollection> <syncfusion:NodeViewModel Key = "Basic Shapes" Name="Triangle" OffsetX="100" OffsetY="100" UnitHeight="100" UnitWidth="100" Shape="{StaticResource Triangle}" ShapeStyle="{StaticResource nodestyle}" > </syncfusion:NodeViewModel> </syncfusion:SymbolCollection> </syncfusion:Stencil.SymbolSource> <syncfusion:Stencil.SymbolGroups> <syncfusion:SymbolGroups> <!--Separate groups based on the key--> <syncfusion:SymbolGroupProvider MappingName = "Key" /> </ syncfusion:SymbolGroups> </syncfusion:Stencil.SymbolGroups> </syncfusion:Stencil>

Gets or sets the title template used to display the title of the Stencil.
Below example shows how to update the title of the stencil through TitleTemplate.
<DataTemplate x:Key="TitleTemplate"> <TextBlock Text="{Binding}" Foreground="Black" FontSize="14" ></TextBlock> </DataTemplate> <syncfusion:Stencil x:Name="stencil" Width="250" ExpandMode="All" Title="Stencil Shapes" TitleTemplate="{StaticResource TitleTemplate}" > <!--Initialize the SymbolSource--> <syncfusion:Stencil.SymbolSource> <!--Define the SymbolCollection--> <syncfusion:SymbolCollection> <syncfusion:NodeViewModel Key = "Basic Shapes" Name="Triangle" OffsetX="100" OffsetY="100" UnitHeight="100" UnitWidth="100" Shape="{StaticResource Triangle}" ShapeStyle="{StaticResource nodestyle}" > </syncfusion:NodeViewModel> </syncfusion:SymbolCollection> </syncfusion:Stencil.SymbolSource> <syncfusion:Stencil.SymbolGroups> <syncfusion:SymbolGroups> <!--Separate groups based on the key--> <syncfusion:SymbolGroupProvider MappingName = "Key" /> </ syncfusion:SymbolGroups> </syncfusion:Stencil.SymbolGroups> </syncfusion:Stencil>

Gets or sets the value indicates whether to show/hide the display mode toggle button. The default value is true.
Below example shows how to hide the display mode toggle button in Stencil.
<syncfusion:Stencil x:Name="stencil" Width="250" Title="Stencil Shapes" ShowDisplayModeToggleButton="false" > <!--Initialize the SymbolSource--> <syncfusion:Stencil.SymbolSource> <!--Define the SymbolCollection--> <syncfusion:SymbolCollection> <syncfusion:NodeViewModel Key = "Basic Shapes" Name="Triangle" OffsetX="100" OffsetY="100" UnitHeight="100" UnitWidth="100" Shape="{StaticResource Triangle}" ShapeStyle="{StaticResource nodestyle}" > </syncfusion:NodeViewModel> </syncfusion:SymbolCollection> </syncfusion:Stencil.SymbolSource> <syncfusion:Stencil.SymbolGroups> <syncfusion:SymbolGroups> <!--Separate groups based on the key--> <syncfusion:SymbolGroupProvider MappingName = "Key" /> </ syncfusion:SymbolGroups> </syncfusion:Stencil.SymbolGroups> </syncfusion:Stencil>

Gets or sets a value that specifies how the stencil and content areas of a stencil are being shown. A value of the enumeration that specifies how the stencil and content areas of a stencil are being shown.
Below example shows how to display the stencil in compact view.
<syncfusion:Stencil x:Name="stencil" Width="250" DisplayMode="Compact"> <!--Initialize the SymbolSource--> <syncfusion:Stencil.SymbolSource> <!--Define the SymbolCollection--> <syncfusion:SymbolCollection> <syncfusion:NodeViewModel Key = "Basic Shapes" Name="Triangle" OffsetX="100" OffsetY="100" UnitHeight="100" UnitWidth="100" Shape="{StaticResource Triangle}" ShapeStyle="{StaticResource nodestyle}" > </syncfusion:NodeViewModel> </syncfusion:SymbolCollection> </syncfusion:Stencil.SymbolSource> <syncfusion:Stencil.SymbolGroups> <syncfusion:SymbolGroups> <!--Separate groups based on the key--> <syncfusion:SymbolGroupProvider MappingName = "Key" /> </ syncfusion:SymbolGroups> </syncfusion:Stencil.SymbolGroups> </syncfusion:Stencil>

Gets or sets value indicates whether to display the symbol search textbox in the Stencil.
true to show the search textbox in stencil;Otherwise false. The default value is set to true..
Below example shows how to enable the search textbox in stencil.
<syncfusion:Stencil x:Name="stencil" Width="250" ExpandMode="All" ShowSearchTextBox="True"> <!--Initialize the SymbolSource--> <syncfusion:Stencil.SymbolSource> <!--Define the SymbolCollection--> <syncfusion:SymbolCollection> <syncfusion:NodeViewModel Key = "Basic Shapes" Name="Triangle" OffsetX="100" OffsetY="100" UnitHeight="100" UnitWidth="100" Shape="{StaticResource Triangle}" ShapeStyle="{StaticResource nodestyle}" > </syncfusion:NodeViewModel> </syncfusion:SymbolCollection> </syncfusion:Stencil.SymbolSource> <syncfusion:Stencil.SymbolGroups> <syncfusion:SymbolGroups> <!--Separate groups based on the key--> <syncfusion:SymbolGroupProvider MappingName = "Key" /> </ syncfusion:SymbolGroups> </syncfusion:Stencil.SymbolGroups> </syncfusion:Stencil>

But, can able to view the outline of the connectors, by holding dragging objects for certain time span. ConnectorRefreshingSpan property of PreviewSettings allows to specify the time span and the value should be greater than 300ms.

Nodes are used to host graphical objects that can be arranged and manipulated on a diagram page.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.SnapToObject
member.summary: Specifies to represent when you draw, resize, or move a shape or other object in diagram, you can set it so that it will align or "snap” to the nearest intersection in the diagram element or snap to other shapes or objects.

member.summary: Disables all the snapping behaviors for Nodes/Connectors to objects.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.SnapToObject.LeftLeft
member.summary: Enables or disables the snapping when the dragging or rezing object meets to the nearest intersection (both dragging and diagramming elements nearest intersect with Left bounds) in the diagram elements.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.SnapToObject.TopTop
member.summary: Enables or disables the snapping when the dragging or rezing object meets to the nearest intersection (both dragging and diagramming elements nearest intersect with Top bounds) in the diagram elements.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.SnapToObject.RightRight
member.summary: Enables or disables the snapping when the dragging or rezing object meets to the nearest intersection (both dragging and diagramming elements nearest intersect with right bounds) in the diagram elements.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.SnapToObject.BottomBottom
member.summary: Enables or disables the snapping when the dragging or rezing object meets to the nearest intersection (both dragging and diagramming elements nearest intersect with bottom bounds) in the diagram elements.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.SnapToObject.LeftRight
member.summary: Enables or disables the snapping when the dragging or rezing object meets to the nearest intersection (The dragging object as left bound and diagramming elements right bound nearest intersect) in the diagram elements.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.SnapToObject.RightLeft
member.summary: Enables or disables the snapping when the dragging or rezing object meets to the nearest intersection (The dragging object as right bound and diagramming elements left bound nearest intersect) in the diagram elements.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.SnapToObject.TopBottom
member.summary: Enables or disables the snapping when the dragging or rezing object meets to the nearest intersection (The dragging object as Top bound and diagramming elements Bottom bound nearest intersect) in the diagram elements.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.SnapToObject.BottomTop
member.summary: Enables or disables the snapping when the dragging or rezing object meets to the nearest intersection (The dragging object as Bottom bound and diagramming elements Top bound nearest intersect) in the diagram elements.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.SnapToObject.HorizontalCenter
member.summary: Enables or disables the snapping when the dragging or rezingobject meets to the nearest intersection (Both dragging and horizontally placed node center bounds intersect each other) in the diagram elements.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.SnapToObject.VerticalCenter
member.summary: Enables or disables the snapping when the dragging or rezing object meets to the nearest intersection (Both dragging and vertically placed node center bounds intersect each other) in the diagram elements.

member.summary: Enables or disables the snapping when the dragging or rezing object holds equal space horizontally to the nearest diagram elements.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.SnapToObject.VerticalSpacing
member.summary: Enables or disables the snapping when dragging or rezing object holds equal space vertically to the nearest diagram elements.

member.summary: Enables or disables the snapping when dragging or rezing object holds equal heigth to the nearest diagram elements.

member.summary: Enables or disables the snapping when the dragging or rezing object meets to the nearest intersection (both dragging and diagramming elements nearest intersect with Left to left or left to right bounds) in the diagram elements.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.SnapToObject.Right
member.summary: Enables or disables the snapping when the dragging or rezing object meets to the nearest intersection (both dragging and diagramming elements nearest intersect with right to right or right to left bounds) in the diagram elements.

member.summary: Enables or disables the snapping when the dragging or rezing object meets to the nearest intersection (both dragging and diagramming elements nearest intersect with top to top or top to bottom bounds) in the diagram elements.

member.summary: Enables or disables the snapping when the dragging or rezing object meets to the nearest intersection (both dragging and diagramming elements nearest intersect with bottom to bottom or bottom to top bounds) in the diagram elements.

member.summary: Enables or disables the snapping when dragging or rezing object holds equal width or height to the nearest diagram elements.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.Diagram.Layout.DirectedTreeLayout
member.summary: Represents a class to arrange the nodes and connectors automatically in a tree structure.
member.example:
Below code shows how to create Hierarchical tree layout # [Model.cs](#tab/tabid-1)
public class Employee { public string Name { get; set; } public string EmpId { get; set; } public string ParentId { get; set; } public string Designation { get; set; } }
public class Employees : ObservableCollection<Employee> { }
# [MainWindow.xaml](#tab/tabid-2)
<!-- Initializes the employee collection--> <local:Employees x:Key="employees"> <local:Employee Name = "Steve" EmpId="1" ParentId="" Designation="CEO"/> <local:Employee Name = "Kevin" EmpId="2" ParentId="1" Designation="Manager"/> <local:Employee Name = "John" EmpId="3" ParentId="1" Designation="Manager"/> <local:Employee Name = "Raj" EmpId="4" ParentId="2" Designation="Team Lead"/> <local:Employee Name = "Will" EmpId="5" ParentId="2" Designation="S/w Developer"/> <local:Employee Name = "Sarah" EmpId="6" ParentId="3" Designation="TeamLead"/> <local:Employee Name = "Mike" EmpId="7" ParentId="3" Designation="Testing Engineer"/> </local:Employees>
<!--Initializes the DataSourceSettings --> <syncfusion:DataSourceSettings x:Key="dataSourceSettings" Id="EmpId" ParentId="ParentId" DataSource="{StaticResource employees}" />
<!--Initialize the Layout--> <syncfusion:DirectedTreeLayout x:Name="DirectedTreeLayout" x:Key="treeLayout" HorizontalSpacing="30" VerticalSpacing="50" Orientation="TopToBottom" Type="Hierarchical" SpaceBetweenSubTrees="20" />
<!--Initialize the Layout Manager--> <syncfusion:LayoutManager x:Key="layoutManager" Layout="{StaticResource treeLayout}"/> <!--Initializes the SfDiagram--> <syncfusion:SfDiagram x:Name="Diagram" DataSourceSettings="{StaticResource dataSourceSettings}" LayoutManager="{Binding layoutManager}"/>
